ygData.subject: Re: Sometimes it's Hard to be a Bard
ygData.msgSnippet: LOL LOL  Yaaaaaa!!! You and your song are hits. Welcome to the Hit Parade!!!!  LOL  Great and timely tune you sing. Sad that it is all so very true and every
ygData.messageBody:
LOL LOL Yaaaaaa!!! You and your song are hits.
Welcome to the Hit Parade!!!! LOL Great and timely
tune you sing. Sad that it is all so very true and
every day real in Norrath.Should be named Brad's
Lullaby maybe?

Talbas
Songsinger on Xegony

--- Robin Wise 3 <eurmali@...> wrote:
> >Message: 18
> > Date: Sun, 05 Dec 1999 18:43:21 -0600
> > From: Talies the Wanderer <snicker@...>
> >Subject: RE: Bard sit in or Mana Song walkout or
> whatever (long, possibly
> >rant ish)
> >
> >We're Bards, right?
>
> Waitaminute, I thought we were necromancers...
> hehehe oops do I feel like a
> ninny. No wonder those bone chips never worked.
>
> >So.... who's up to a little composition? Sing a
> little here... sing a
> >little there.... sing to the news guys.. sing to
> the news groups...
>
> Well, here's something I threw together last night:
>
> Sometimes it's Hard to be a Bard
>
> Sometimes it's hard to be a bard, although I have to
> say,
> I love it though it hurts to know it's changing
> every day
> In ways I think the gods must blink in puzzlement to
> see -
> The many ways these changing days have been the
> death of me.
>
> I've had a song, though not for long, a joy for me
> to play
> It let me fly across the sky, but then, the other
> day
> My levitate began to wait before it would relight
> And so I fell and died, oh well... a casualty of
> Flight.
>
> I have a greed for superspeed, I simply hate to wait
> To break a root, there's no dispute, Accelerando's
> great
> And then one day, to my dismay, ghoul-rooted and in
> need,
> My precious tune did nothing boon... a casualty of
> Speed.
>
> I've one refrain, a sonic chain - it slows the
> target down
> Reducing flight, and in a fight, it's justly won
> renown.
> A fleeing whelp returned with help; one change my
> fate explains -
> Since he had SoW, I could not slow... a casualty of
> Chains.
>
> I'm very sad to say I had the horrid luck to see
> Upon the plain, through fog and rain, The Thing That
> Must Not Be.
> To show their ire, the gods rained fire, and both of
> us were charred...
> Apparently the gods could see the Thing but not the
> bard.
>
> Sometimes it's hard to be a bard, although I have to
> say,
> I love it though it hurts to know it's changing
> every day
> In ways I think the gods must blink in puzzlement to
> see -
> The many ways these changing days have been the
> death of me.
>
> Aloro Silvertongue (E'ci)
> I'm sure there are some other stanzas I should
> include, but can't think of
> what other unintended/undocumented nerfs have hit us
> lately. Any
> suggestions?
>
>
------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter
> to lol@... with the subject submissions.
>
<HR>
<html>
>
